title: Police under scrutiny for handcuffing of top athletes after stop and search incident
description: British sprinter Bianca Williams says she hopes an investigation that has been launched into a controversial handcuffing incident involving herself and her partner will be "rigorous."

title: 'Glee' actress presumed dead after disappearing at California lake
description: Rescuers will resume their search Thursday morning for "Glee" actress Naya Rivera after she went missing from a lake in Southern California.

title: Bill Nye takes to TikTok to explain why we should all wear a face mask
description: Bill Nye the Science Guy took to TikTok to demonstrate why the general public should wear a mask.

title: US targets Chinese officials for Xinjiang human rights abuses
description: The Trump administration has taken action against Chinese officials for their involvement in human rights abuses in the Xinjiang region, where Uyghur Muslims and other minority groups have been detained and tortured.

title: How America's summer reopening went off the rails
description: The sprawling Camp Ozark in Mount Ida, Arkansas, was shuttered after an undisclosed number of campers and a counselor contracted the coronavirus.

title: Declassified files show deployed US troops exposed to toxins in wake of 9/11
description: A bipartisan group of lawmakers on Thursday released a collection of newly declassified Defense Department documents indicating that US troops who were deployed to a Central Asian base in the wake of the 9/11 attacks were likely exposed to a dangerous mix of toxins and other hazards, which some believe has led to increased cancer rates among US service members stationed there.

title: China smacks down US attempt to say Beijing is willing to engage in nuclear talks
description: China issued a stinging response to a US statement Thursday that welcomed Beijing's willingness to engage in arms control talks.

title: 'Far Side' cartoonist publishes first new work in 25 years
description: "Enter if you dare," is the message on Gary Larson's website challenging people to explore his new content. "The Far Side" cartoonist surprised fans this week when he published never-before-seen comics for the first time in 25 years.

title: Republican says he'd rather vote for a 'tuna fish sandwich' over Trump
description: Ads aren't unusual for an election year, but as CNN's Jeff Zeleny reports, Republican "Never Trump" groups are spending millions hoping to make the leader of their party a one-term president.

title: New WHO report says airborne coronavirus transmission 'cannot be ruled out' in outbreaks in some indoor settings
description: The World Health Organization on Thursday released a new scientific report detailing how the coronavirus can pass from one person to the next -- including through the air during certain medical procedures, and possibly through the air in crowded indoor spaces.

title: Supreme Court shuts the door on Trump's election doomsday scenario
Watch Trump react to Supreme Court's ruling on his taxes
description: President Donald Trump lashed out after the Supreme Court ruled that the President is not immune from a New York prosecutor's subpoena for his tax return.

title: New York City paints Black Lives Matter mural outside Trump Tower
description: New York City is painting a Black Lives Matter mural on the street directly outside of Trump Tower in Midtown Manhattan.

title: New outbreaks raise questions about when the worst-hit countries will ever return to normal
Two-thirds of Americans want to be able to sue police for excessive force
description: More Americans support keeping spending on policing in their areas about the same (42%) than want it increased (31%) or decreased (25%), according to a poll from the Pew Research Center released Thursday.

title: Theme park reopens with strange new rule
description: A theme park in Fujiyoshida, Japan, is banning screaming on its roller coasters to prevent the spread of Covid-19 and instead is urging customers to "scream in their hearts."

title: GOP governor: I think Trump is confused
description: President Trump slammed the CDC's guidance for reopening schools, but Maryland's GOP Gov. Larry Hogan says the guidance was helpful and he believes Trump is confused about it.

title: Supreme Court shuts door on Trump's election doomsday scenario
description:
• Opinion: What's behind Roberts' stinging rebuke of Trump
• Trump fires off tweetstorm after ruling
• Analysis: 1 big thing Trump still doesn't get about the Supreme Court

title: Supreme Court rules broad swath of Oklahoma is Native American land
description: The Supreme Court said Thursday that a large swath of eastern Oklahoma, including Tulsa, is Native American land for purposes of federal criminal law in a decision that the state argued could call into question thousands of state prosecutions for serious crimes.

title: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, tries to stop her friends from being named in lawsuit
description: The battle between Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, and a top British tabloid is heating up.

title: Trump is now blocking most of the legal paths to US immigration
description: As the coronavirus spreads around the world, the Trump administration has steadily choked off most avenues for legal immigration to the United States -- effectively shutting down the system that brings in hundreds of thousands of immigrants annually.

title: Hong Kong warns of potential 'exponential growth' in cases
description: Authorities in Hong Kong, a city lauded for its quick and effective response to the coronavirus pandemic, are now warning of potential "exponential growth" in new cases of Covid-19 after a surge in local transmissions.

title: Neo-Nazis tell followers to 'deliberately infect' Jews, Muslims
description: Neo-Nazis and far-right activists have been telling followers to "deliberately infect" Jews and Muslims with coronavirus, a UK government counterterrorism agency warned on Thursday, as extremists attempt to capitalize on the pandemic.

title: Melania Trump statue in Slovenia removed after being set on fire
description: A statue of Melania Trump has been removed from near her hometown in Slovenia after being badly burned by vandals, the artist who commissioned the sculpture told CNN Thursday.

title: HSBC may have to choose between East and West as China tightens grip on Hong Kong
description: HSBC has carved out a lucrative role in global banking over the past 155 years by straddling the line between East and West. Now, a political firestorm over the bank's hometown of Hong Kong could force the bank to choose sides.

title: An extinct giant dolphin behaved like a killer whale, study finds
description: Dolphins may seem cute and friendly, but the largest member of the dolphin family is actually none other than the ultimate hunter of the sea — the killer whale, also known as an orca.

title: 'It's distressing' that no Black player has reached Wimbledon final in 24 years, says former finalist
description: MaliVai Washington is a "little sad." That's because he holds a 24-year record that he never expected to possess for so long --  he's the last African-American man to reach a grand slam final.

title: World's rarest gorillas spotted with babies in Nigeria's forest
description: In a rare sighting, conservationists have captured new images of the world's rarest gorillas with several babies in southern Nigeria.

title: Will Smith says police have called him the n-word multiple times
description: Will Smith opened up about experiences he had with police in Philadelphia as the US continues to grapple with the death of multiple Black Americans at the hands of the police.

title: Auschwitz survivor to meet family of American GI whose kind gesture gave her hope
description: A survivor of the Auschwitz Nazi concentration camp, now living in London, will have a Zoom meeting next week with the children of an American GI who liberated her -- and gave her a small gift of hope.

title: Global temperatures could exceed crucial 1.5 C target in the next five years
description: There is an increasing chance that annual global temperatures could exceed 1.5 degrees Celsius (2.7 degrees Fahrenheit) above pre-industrial levels over the next five years, new climate predictions from the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) say.

title: After months of debate over its design, the rebuilt Notre Dame cathedral could look exactly the same
description: Anyone hoping to see the Notre Dame's fire-wrecked spire rise from the ashes as a gleaming, ultra-modern version of its former self may be set for disappointment.

title: TikTok is a national security threat, politicians say. Here's what experts think
description: The short-form video app TikTok has quickly become a key part of popular culture in the US, serving as a platform for viral memes as well as political satire and activism. Facebook, the dominant force in social media, has tried to copy the app, but so far that has not slowed down its rapid rise.

title: UFO spaceport theories that don't go away
description: Erich von Däniken dried his sweaty palms with granite dust as he scaled the Great Pyramid of Giza, crawling block by block up the nearly 4,000-year-old monument.

title: Indigenous Americans had contact with Polynesians 800 years ago, DNA study confirms
description: Indigenous Americans and Polynesians crossed thousands of miles of open ocean and made contact with each other as early as 1200 A.D., centuries before the arrival of Europeans, a new study has found.

title: 'Furious' crowd riots against curfew, breaks into parliament
description: Police in the Serbian capital Belgrade clashed with protesters demonstrating against the country's President Aleksandar Vucic after he announced a weekend-long curfew to combat a surge in coronavirus cases. CNN's Milena Veselinovic reports.

title: Thailand could become the first Southeast Asian country to legalize same-sex civil partnerships
description: Thailand's Cabinet on Wednesday approved a draft bill that will legally recognize same-sex civil partnerships and give greater rights to same-sex couples, a potential first for any nation in Southeast Asia if passed into law.

title: Scientists learn from '100,000 years of experience'
description: Scientists have become adept at tracking wildlife remotely. Take the Icarus global monitoring system, for example. Soon data ranging from an animal's location to its skin temperature will be easily available thanks to tiny wearable transmitters that send signals to an antenna on the International Space Station. But there's still something to be said for boots on the ground.

title: Australia suspends extradition with Hong Kong and offers path to citizenship for city's residents
description: Australia has suspended its extradition treaty with Hong Kong, Prime Minister Scott Morrison announced Thursday, as the country moves to offer a path to citizenship for those Hong Kongers who wish to leave the city.

title: Trackers are helping to conserve the Kalahari
description: Traditional trackers are monitoring wildlife using CyberTracker software.

title: As parts of Australia go back into lockdown, what hope is there for the rest of the world?
description: It wasn't supposed to be like this.

title: Fox News host attacked war veteran Sen. Duckworth. See CNN anchor's fiery response
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar fires back at Fox News host Tucker Carlson who claimed that Purple Heart veteran Sen. Tammy Duckworth (D-IL) is unpatriotic following her suggestion for a national dialogue about removing historical monuments.

title: Internet goes wild searching for #SATGUY who allegedly took Trump's exams
description: Internet sleuths try to score the name of the guy who allegedly took Trump's SATs for him. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Remember the '80s? Take a look back at what we wore
description: The 1980s was possibly the boldest decade in modern fashion history, a magical era of over-the-top silhouettes, teased perms and saturated colors. They were the years of puffed shoulders and power suits, flashy skirts and spandex leggings, velour, leg warmers and voluminous parachute pants.
